intro: Macaranga sampsonii, commonly known as the giant tallow tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant is deciduous, shedding its leaves during the dry season. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Macaranga sampsonii is often found in lowland rainforests and can grow up to 30 meters tall.
